title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live Friday 1 December 2017 - BBC News
summary: prince harry and meghan markle have greeted crowds in nottingham .
it was the couple 's first public engagement .
they visited a charity fair and met students at nottingham academy .
sir alan duncan intervenes to stop doggy death sentence .
council u-turn over christmas tree cordon .
plans submitted for new moorways swimming pool .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: today 's updates have finished and will resume at 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: meghan says goodbye to nottingham - for now
text: here 's one more photo of meghan markle - taken as she was leaving the east midlands following this afternoon 's visit to nottingham academy .
fingers crossed it wo n't be too long before the happy couple are back in the region .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: weather : milder night expected
text: a dry end to the day but cloud will increase overnight with the potential for one or two spots of rain .
not as cold as recent nights .
lows of 2c ( 36f ) .
author: Anna Church
Weather Presenter, BBC East Midlands Today

documents.title: suicide pact victim 's family 'heartbroken '
text: the parents of matthew birkinshaw said their son 's death has left a `` space no-one else can ever fill '' .
it follows the conviction of natasha gordon for encouraging his suicide in a car park at rutland water .
they said : `` it is impossible to put into words the effect the loss of matthew has had on our family .
`` he was everything to us and he has left a space no-one else can ever fill . ''
they added : `` it has become clear to us during this process how many people consider suicide without ever displaying any signs even to those closest to them .
it has been heartbreaking to hear how when matt needed kindness and support , he met someone who wanted to do him harm . ''

documents.title: armed gang raid couple 's home
text: an axe wielding gang threatened a couple before holding them down and searching their home , police said .
the three men - one brandishing the weapon - burst into a home in pear tree crescent in derby on tuesday evening .
one man threatened the pair with an axe while the other two held down the homeowners .
the trio fled when one of the victims escaped and ran for help .
derbyshire police are appealing for witnesses to the incident which happened at about 19:00 on tuesday .
author: Ben Truslove
BBC News Online

documents.title: royal visit a 'knock out '
text: that 's quite the right hook
prince harry and fiancee meghan markle visited nottingham academy earlier where they met teachers and students who are part of the full effect programme .
the charity is supported by the prince and aims to reduce youth crime and violence in the st ann 's area of the city .
author: Ben Truslove
BBC News Online

documents.title: minister calls for army dog reprieve
text: minister calls for army dog reprieve

documents.title: pc sacked for 'flirty messages ' to crime victims
text: a police officer who sent `` suggestive and flirtatious messages '' to vulnerable victims of crime has been sacked .
ben bradshaw , a 37-year-old pc for nottinghamshire police , admitted gross misconduct and misconduct which breached the standards expected of him between june 2012 and april 2016 .
a hearing this morning at force headquarters , found he sent the messages to women he came into contact with through his work as an officer based in watnall .

chief constable craig guildford said : reputationally the conduct is thoroughly discreditable and undermines all the hard work which dedicated and professional officers and staff undertake in supporting vulnerable victims on a daily basis . ''
author: Ben Truslove
BBC News Online

documents.title: the uk 's dodgy christmas displays
text: the uk 's dodgy christmas displays

documents.title: breakdown leads to m1 delays
text: this rather fuzzy photo from highways england can only mean one thing - traffic delays .
it 's a broken down car and has led to a lane being closed on the m1 southbound between junctions 25 and 24a .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: sir alan duncan intervenes to stop doggy death sentence
text: two retired army dogs who face being put down because they can not be rehomed must be reprieved , a minister has said .

rutland and melton mp sir alan duncan has intervened in a bid to save kevin and dazz - reported to have served in afghanistan locating explosives - by writing to ministry of defence ministerial colleagues .
the belgian shepherds are due to face lethal injections next week , but former soldiers and handlers have written to the defence animal centre in melton mowbray for the decision to be reversed .
sir alan said : `` these are hero dogs who have fought fearlessly alongside our soldiers .
`` let us now be the ones to fight for them and give them a chance to live happy lives where they can thrive .
it is the least they deserve . ''
an mod spokesman said : `` wherever possible , we endeavour to re-home them [ dogs ] at the end of their service life .
sadly , there are some occasions where this is not possible . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: 'suicide pact ' trial : natasha gordon found guilty
text: a woman has been found guilty of encouraging the suicide of a man she met online .
natasha gordon , 44 , from peterborough , had denied encouraging or assisting in the death of matthew birkinshaw .
the 31-year-old postman , from walsall , was found dead in his car at rutland water in december 2015 .
gordon was found guilty at leicester crown court .
sentencing has been adjourned to a later date .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: man helps release mental health single
text: man helps release mental health single

documents.title: roads reopen after royal visit
text: all roads have now re-opened .
thank you for your patience and co-operation # royalvisit # nottingham # keepingyousafe
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: crowds share couple 's 'fairytale ' moment
text: crowds share couple 's 'fairytale ' moment
author: Samantha Fisher
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'laughing policeman ' remembered
text: a memorial to `` england 's heaviest police officer '' , who is thought to be the inspiration behind the laughing policeman song , has been unveiled .
pc john `` tubby '' stephens , who weighed 24 stone 3lbs ( 154kg ) , served as an officer in leicester for 22 years during the late 1800s and early 1900s .
he was known for having a `` larger-than-life '' character and crowds of people would follow him around while on duty .
despite his popularity , stephens was buried in an unmarked grave , as experts believe the plot belonged to the barker family , who were his neighbours .
following 12 months of research , leicestershire 's police federation has paid for a stone at stephens ' grave to properly recognise his legacy .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: football : puel wary of 'confident ' burnley
text: leicester city manager claude puel has warned his players to expect `` good football '' and not just `` physicality '' from tomorrow 's visitors burnley .
the clarets , who have defied expectations so far this season , lie sixth in the table , three places above puel 's foxes .
puel said : `` we have to be careful .
if we watch burnley , the table does n't lie .
i think they are sixth , it is a fantastic season for them .
they have confidence and are a strong team .
`` they are not just physical , they start with the ball and try to play good football and have had good results away from home .
it 's a big challenge for us but also for them . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: christmas tree 'exclusion zone ' u-turn
text: a council has admitted it was `` over cautious '' when it installed a widely-ridiculed cordon around a christmas tree for public safety .
derby city council said it created the `` exclusion zone '' in market place to `` enable people to view the tree at a safe distance '' .
people complained it was `` a disgusting mess '' and `` not festive at all '' .
most of the metal fencing has now been removed but a smaller barrier ( above ) remains around the tree .
author: Caroline Lowbridge
BBC News

documents.title: end of prince harry and meghan markle coverage
text: prince harry and meghan markle 's visit to nottingham is now over - we hope you have enjoyed our coverage of this memorable day .
there 's a comprehensive round up of the couple 's visit here .
east midlands live , the news service for nottinghamshire , derbyshire , leicestershire and rutland will now resume on this page until 18:00 .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: day to remember for nottingham and royal couple
text: here are a few more cracking of a memorable day in nottingham .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: americans love 'glamour and traditions ' of royals
text: terry moran , from the american broadcaster abc , has been in nottingham covering the visit of prince harry and meghan markle .
mr moran claims americans are enthralled by the royals and their story .
he said : `` we love the glamour , we love the tradition that we do n't have .
`` here is a story where we have one of our own , an american woman , who is going to be stepping into that family in what looks to be a really happy way . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: crowds disperse outside school
text: a lot of the crowd waiting for prince harry and meghan markle at nottingham academy have now gone .
die-hard fans like tara and baby lydia are still here though .
author: Hayley Compton
Reporter, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: warmly jovial atmosphere in nottingham
text: it was cold on nottingham 's high pavement but the atmosphere was warmly jovial .
there was an eager anticipation in the crowd first thing - with some hardy souls queuing from dawn this morning - but that gave way to excitement later on .
by the time the happy couple arrived the pavements were packed with well-wishing fans , many shouting congratulations .
the delighted onlookers hope it wo n't be too long before the happy couple return .
author: Liam Barnes
BBC News, at the scene

documents.title: royal couple depart school
text: prince harry and meghan markle have now left nottingham academy , concluding their visit to nottingham .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: harry and meghan get full effect update
text: smiles all round .
next , hrh and ms. markle visit @ twitterid to see the work of @ twitterid - a programme established by prince harry through the royal foundation to prevent young people getting involved in crime .
@ wearefulleffect helps vulnerable young people in the st ann 's area of nottingham through early intervention , mentorship & training .
more here :
prince harry and ms. markle spoke to head teachers about what effect @ twitterid is having on their school communities .
great to see our very own headteacher chatting !
@ twitterid - we need an autograph ! !
love those two
i 'm loving these two together publicly .
for some reason , i see them doing wonderful things for humanity .
lady diana 's spirit is evident in her sons .
look how happy this young man is with his future wife
you both look so happy and professional
hop over and see our award winning conversation cards , helping you , help young people talk , about issues in their lives # talkingiskey # 23to # allinonebox
it 's really important that this conversation took place with all those involved .
no one wants these children as adults to fail .
good on you all .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: prince and meghan greet school children
text: the newly-engaged couple - here braving the cold without those snazzy coats - greeted staff and students at nottingham academy .

documents.title: royal pair to watch 'hip hopera ' at school
text: at nottingham academy , prince harry and meghan markle are finding out about the latest developments with full effect , a youth programme that 's been supported by the prince and his brother , the duke of cambridge , over the past four years .
the scheme aims to stop young people from the st ann 's area of nottingham getting involved in violence and crime through a combination of early intervention , mentoring and training .
before they leave , the couple are due to watch a `` hip hopera '' performed by students .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: your comments : royal visit to nottingham
text: there are plenty of lovely messages about prince harry and meghan markle coming to nottingham on the bbc facebook pages .
sean flynn said : `` fantastic to see the couple in nottingham . ''
mehrun bondary said : `` we wish both of them the best loads happiness . ''
frank sukhdev singh johal said : `` wishing all things good .
just magic . ''
author: Facebook

documents.title: watch : couple greeted at nottingham school
text: prince harry and meghan markle were greeted with shouts of `` congratulations '' as they arrived at nottingham academy .
the pair have been meeting those involved in the full effect project , established by the prince to try and prevent youth violence and crime .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

she showed no sign of nerves , '' one broadcaster said during a live report to back across the atlantic .

documents.title: royals spend 'as much time as possible ' with crowd
text: the former royal spokesman has been explaining to the bbc why prince harry and meghan markle took their time to talk to as many people as possible on their 30-minute walkabout .
it is important that they meet as many people as possible .

they ( the crowds ) are standing out there , they 're cold , they 've been waiting a long time , and the feeling is if they have waited for us , then we can spend as much time as possible with them . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: cold weather , warm welcome
text: the welcome might be warm but you can see how cold it is in nottingham from prince harry 's breath .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: well-wisher : meghan markle 'very nice '
text: lynn greaves was one of the lucky few to be able to speak to prince harry and meghan .
she says she congratulated the couple on their engagement and wished them well .
she added that meghan was `` very nice '' .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: watch : crowds speak of 'fantastic ' royal encounter
text: people who saw and spoke to prince harry and meghan markle have been sharing their experiences .

BBC News

documents.title: media throng awaits royal couple 's gallery exit
text: the prince and meghan are inside the nottingham contemporary , but the world 's press remain on the street - hoping to catch a glimpse of the couple when they leave .
an american broadcaster is currently doing a live report , presumably for one of the country 's breakfast tv shows .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: who made meghan 's coat ?
text: for all you fashion fans , apparently meghan 's coat is made by canadian brand mackage .
the actress is said to be a longtime fan of the company , whose clothes have also been spotted on the likes of madonna , gwyneth paltrow and blake lively .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: crowds desperate to get close to royal pair
text: here 's a great shot illustrating the clamour to speak to the newly-engaged pair earlier .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: royal couple 's walkabout 'amazing '
text: june green , from nottingham , has been describing the moment prince harry and meghan markle met well wishers .
the couple spent around 15 minutes meeting members of the public , some of whom had been waiting for hours to catch a glimpse of the prince and meghan .
it was amazing , '' ms green said .
they spent ages greeting everyone .
it is great for nottingham . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: engaged markle shows off ring
text: meghan markle was not shy about showing off that stunning engagement ring harry gave her last month .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: royal visit 'most exciting thing ever '
text: jayd kilarski and her friend kathryn hague waited in the cold from 7:30 for the happy couple in nottingham .
rather optimistically , jayd said she was still hoping harry would `` fall madly in love with me '' .
when i heard they were coming i thought this is the most exciting thing ever .
it 's their first royal engagement together and they 're in nottingham .
i could not really miss that . ''
author: Samantha Fisher
BBC News

documents.title: royal couple head to world aids day event
text: prince harry and meghan markle are now inside the nottingham contemporary art gallery , which is hosting a terrence higgins trust world aids day charity fair .

they 'll be introduced to staff from the charity along with members of the african institute for social development and champions for change , who each support local communities in nottingham and do specific work around hiv/aids .
they 're also due to meet representatives from the food chain and bhiva , which support people living with hiv and work towards eradicating the stigma associated with hiv/aids .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: watch : 'sweet ' card given to royal couple
text: a card designed in nottingham , especially for prince harry and meghan markle , was given to them earlier .
ms markle was heard saying the gesture was `` so sweet '' .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: royal couple side by side for chat with well-wishers
text: prince harry and meghan were handed flowers and cards by well-wishers , many of whom had been waiting several hours in the cold to see them .
the couple stood side-by-side to chat to people in the crowd who were keen to know more about their wedding arrangements .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: meghan 'will be asset to royal family '
text: karen and lynn greaves , from nottingham , say they are always keen to see the royals when they visit the city .
it is a historic occasion , '' karen ( left ) said .
we 've seen diana , princess of wales , and prince charles . ''
karen added that meghan markle is a bright , intelligent and articulate '' woman who will be an asset to the royal family .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: cameras at the ready
text: the world 's press awaits the arrival of prince harry and meghan markle .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: major police presence in nottingham for royal couple
text: as you might expect , there 's a massive police presence ahead of prince harry and meghan markle 's visit to nottingham .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: business offers 'terrace view ' of royal couple
text: the street prince harry and meghan will walk along is lined with pubs , cafes and bars - and they appear keen to cash in .
however people are generally staying outside hoping to catch a glimpse of the newly-engaged couple .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: who is meghan markle ?
text: today will be the public 's first glimpse of meghan markle since she became a royal bride-to-be .
the actress was born on 4 august 1981 and grew up in los angeles in an area described as the `` black beverly hills '' .
her acting career began in the early 2000s and her breakthrough role came in 2011 when she was handed the part of rachel zane in us legal drama suits .
ms markle combined acting with other vocations , including running her own lifestyle blog and humanitarian work .

she met prince harry through mutual friends in july 2016 but the pair kept their relationship low-key until making their first public appearance together at the opening ceremony of the invictus games in toronto in september .
following the announcement of their engagement , ms markle has said she plans to leave acting so the couple can focus on humanitarian causes .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: royals to visit charitable causes
text: prince harry and meghan markle 's visit to the terrence higgins trust in nottingham is to mark the 29th world aids day .
their visit to nottingham academy is to see how full effect is going , a charity established by the prince after he first met young people in the city in 2013 .
it was set up to try and prevent youth violence and crime .
today prince harry and ms. meghan markle will visit nottingham on their first official visit since announcing their engagement .
follow @ twitterid for live updates .
to mark # worldaidsday , hrh and ms. markle will visit nottingham 's @ twitterid charity fair and see the work of @ twitterid at a local school .
good to see them involved in domestic affairs and secondary school .
there are so many problems in secondary schools and youngersters , need help .
so thrilled for the royal family .
adding a us citizen , will i believe make us : # stronger together .
will they hold hands whilst slaughtering our wildlife ?
`` delete ``
# bantrumpfromuk we do n't want that racist , sexual predator , traitor , cockwomble # trump in the uk
the polls showing aprox .
73 % of british public want trump to visit .
only 27 % oppose it .
will be watching in the middle of the night here , your wonderful nuptials , harry and meghan !
best wishes and congratulations !
you 're such a great guy prince harry ! !

i once loved & respected all of you now i see you for the globalist elitist danger you truly are to the world you should be ashamed
@ twitterid @ twitterid wonderful visit to nottingham lots of smiling faces # happyday

good to go .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: crowds building ahead of harry and meghan 's arrival
text: quite a crowd building up along high pavement now where the royal couple are due to go on a walkabout .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: pub doormen hope for royal guests
text: the doormen at the pitcher and piano are hopeful the royal couple will pop in for a pint .
brandon wright and greg cameron have been on duty since 9:00 next door to the contemporary , the art gallery which will host the world aids day charity fair .
brandon said : `` it 's very cold this morning , but at least the sun 's shining .
`` it 's good to see people from all over the country - for some people it 'll be a once in a lifetime thing .
`` i 've always liked prince harry , i really hope he pops in . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: excitement grows over royal couple 's visit
text: crowds gathered waiting for the arrival of prince harry and meghan markle have been describing wanting to be part of the couple 's fairytale '' .

abby gentile , from chicago , mandy koehler , from nebraska , and shannon jauvequi , from california , who are studying in nottingham , said they could not believe their luck when they found out the pair were coming to the city .
we 've never seen a prince , '' an excited ms koehler said .
it 's like a fairytale it only happens once .
so it is great timing for us . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: engagement card for royal couple
text: this special engagement card has been designed for prince harry and meghan markle .
the design of the card was inspired by details the couple revealed in their recent television interview .
when the engagement was announced harry said meghan liked gold .
he also said the couple camped under the stars in botswana .
radio nottingham will be getting people in the city to sign the card and pass on their best wishes to the royal couple .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: students grab prime spot for glimpse of harry and meghan
text: these two students from the university of nottingham set their alarms at 06:00 in order to get a prime spot to try to see prince harry and meghan markle .
raushana nurzhubalina , from kazakhstan , and jenn galandy , from canada , both said they felt it was an opportunity they could not miss .
it is such an honour to see the royals , '' ms nurzhubalina said .
i 'm also a fan of suits , so it is a chance to see a star of that too . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: watch : what will harry and meghan be doing in nottingham ?
text: here 's a little video preview of harry and meghan 's nottingham visit .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: 'upbeat atmosphere ' at glenfield hospital
text: there 's still a feeling of celebration at glenfield hospital after the nhs confirmed it is keeping children 's heart surgery at the leicester unit .
parents , staff and campaigners were `` euphoric '' at the news yesterday after years of campaigning .
jamie and jessica were in the children 's intensive care unit with their 10-week-old baby esme when the news was delivered .
dad jamie said : `` we 're absolutely over the moon that it 's still here .
we 're really happy . ''
student nurse lucy edwards said there was an upbeat atmosphere around work .
`` i 've loved every single minute i 've been on the ward .
it 's really made me realise how much it needed to stay open and i 'm so relieved at the decision . ''
the decision to keep surgery at the east midlands congenital heart unit open is conditional on the hospital achieving `` full compliance with the standards '' .
author: Bridget Blair
BBC Radio Leicester Reporter

documents.title: new moorways swimming pool plans submitted
text: derby city council has formally submitted plans for a new 50m swimming pool complex at moorways - to itself .
the application says a future masterplan for the area could include more buildings which would increase income to the council .
it also says the design of the new leisure centre would make further expansion relatively easy .
a decision from the council is expected by february .
author: Chris Doidge
Political reporter, BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: fire prompts evacuation at hotel and student digs
text: about 100 people were forced to leave a hotel and neighbouring student accommodation in nottingham after a fire broke out last night .
fire fighters were called out to the park plaza hotel in maid marian way just after 21:00 .
the students were allowed back in before midnight but many hotel guests had to spend the night in other accommodation including the britannia hotel .
the fire service says no-one was injured .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: royal fans get into position for couple 's visit
text: well-wishers have already started to arrive in nottingham to catch a glimpse of prince harry and meghan markle .
helena bottomley , zoe scott and carole bingham say they dropped everything '' to come along , once it was announced the prince and meghan would be coming to the city .
the friends , who are from east and west bridgford , have also seen the queen and the duke and duchess of cambridge when they visited .
ms scott said : we love the royals .
we are genuinely happy for harry . ''
we all had our children at the same time as diana [ princess of wales ] so we feel a real allegiance .
she would be so thrilled , '' said ms bottomley .
author: Liam Barnes
BBC News Online

documents.title: children at heart of latest drink-drive campaign
text: derbyshire police have launched their christmas drink-driving awareness campaign .
this year 's push has seen the force produce a video featuring children using toys to tell the story of a crash caused by a drink-driver .
sgt steve hughes , from the roads policing unit , said he hoped the clip would make people `` sit up and take notice '' .
warning : third party content may contain adverts .
last december there were more than 20 crashes in the county caused by drink or drug drivers , with 43 people giving a positive breath test or refusing/being unable to take the test .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: memorial for 'laughing policeman '
text: a memorial to `` england 's heaviest police officer '' , who is thought to be the inspiration behind the laughing policeman song , is to be unveiled .
pc john `` tubby '' stephens , who weighed 24 stone 3lbs ( 154kg ) , served as an officer in leicester for 22 years during the late 1800s and early 1900s .
he was known for having a `` larger-than-life '' character and people would regularly ask for photos with him .
about 10,000 people lined the city 's streets for his funeral .
despite his popularity , stephens , who died in 1908 , aged 48 , was buried in an unmarked grave in leicester .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: nottingham prepares to welcome meghan and harry
text: prince harry and his new fiancee meghan markle are due in nottingham shortly for their first official engagement together .
kensington palace said the couple , who announced their engagement on monday , will start the tour with a civic welcome at the national justice museum in high pavement .
this will be followed by a walkabout where they have the opportunity to greet members of the public as a couple for the first time .
the pair will then visit the nottingham contemporary gallery , which is hosting a terrence higgins trust world aids day charity fair .
they will also head to the nottingham academy to meet headteachers taking part in the full effect programme .
the project provides early intervention and training to children and young people in the st ann 's area of nottingham who may become involved in youth violence and crime .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : today 's weather for the east midlands
text: here 's what friday has in store for us .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live updates
text: hi everyone and welcome to today 's news , sport , travel and weather updates for the east midlands .
author: Gavin Bevis
